alert.note: Alert for San Joaquin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 29 at 4:01PM PDT until March 29 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, San Joaquin and Stanislaus. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Modesto, Turlock, Ceres, Oakdale, Riverbank, Escalon, Empire, Bystrom, Shackelford, Bret Harte, Del Rio, West Modesto, East Oakdale, Eugene, Hughson, Keyes and Denair. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
